2 K.J. Davis

Position Guard

Height 6-5

Weight 200

Class Sophomore

Hometown Portsmouth, Va.

High School I.C. Norcom

Major Business Management

Bio

Related

Stats

Historical

Biography

Career Notes

Played in 55 games during his two seasons at ECU, making 18 starts … Averaged 5.4 points and 3.2 rebounds per game ... Scored double figures in 12 games … Posted one double-double … Was the first player in Class of 2017 to sign with the Pirates, inking his NLI during the fall signing period.

As A Sophomore (2018-19)

Game-By-Game Statistics

Made 17 starts in 29 games played … Averaged 7.6 points, 4.1 rebounds and 27.1 minutes per game … Finished the season shooting 31.7 percent from the field and 28.8 percent from outside the 3-point arc … Scored double figures in 11 games …. Pulled down five or more rebounds in 13 games … Led the Pirates in scoring against Cincinnati (17) and at UConn (13) … Was the team’s leading rebounder in four games … Recorded his lone double-double of the season with 12 points and 12 rebounds at Memphis … Rejected a team-best 28 shots during the season and ranked 10th in The American with 1.0 blocks per game … Played 30 or more minutes in 12 games.

As A Freshman (2017-18)

Game-By-Game Statistics

Averaged 3.1 points, 2.3 rebounds and 10.7 minutes per game in 26 contests ... Made his lone start of the season Feb. 14 at Tulane ... Scored double figures just once, netting 10 points at home against Tulane ... Grabbed four or more rebounds in a game nine times with a season-best seven at home against Grambling State and UConn ... Posted season-highs for blocked shots (3) and steals (3) at home against SMU ... Buried a season-best three 3-point attempts inside Williams Arena against the Green Wave ... Made his ECU debut in the season opener against Copping State, scoring five points and grabbing four rebounds in 13 minutes of action.

High School

Attended I.C. Norcom High School and graduated with honors … Four-year letterman for coach Leon Goolsby … Averaged 20.3 points, 8.3 rebounds, 2.5 blocks, 2.0 steals and 1.5 blocks per game as a senior … Team posted a combined record of 91-20 during his four years … Member of three consecutive Virginia High School League championship teams at Norcom (2015, ’16, ’17) … Selected the 2017 Virginian-Pilot All-Tidewater Player-of-the-Year … Named 2017 Conference 27 Player-of-the-Year as well as first-team all-conference … Two-time first-team All-Tidewater selection … Voted 2016 Second-Team Virginia High School Coaches Association (VHSCA) All-State 3A Team and First-Team All-Region 3A East … Served as team captain as a senior … Participated in the 2017 Allen Iverson Roundball Classic … Selected to compete in the inaugural Joy Fund All-Star Classic charity game following the 2016-17 season … Scored 45 points as a senior against Churchland High School.

Personal

Full name is Kevin O’Neal Davis, Jr. … Son of Kevin and Morri-Lyn Davis … Has three siblings: Ryan Turner, MyKaylyn Davis and Kamryn Davis.
